messages.body:
FROM THE DESK OF: MURPHY BELLO 


MANAGER CREDIT AND FOREIGN BILLS.
UNION BANK PLC. dr_murphy_bello@ny.com
Attn: Sir
My name is Bello Ali the manager, credit and foreign
bills of Union Bank Nigeria Plc. I am writing in
respect of a foreign customer of my bank
with account number 14-255-2004/utb/t who perished in
a plane crash Korean Air Flight 801] with the whhome to
claim his funds of USD$.30 m,  which has been with my branch for a
very long time. On this note, I decided to seek for a
foreigner who I can present as the next of kin hence
no one has come up to be the next of kin.
And the banking ethics here does not allow such money
to stay more Than Eight years, after which the money
will be called into the bank treasury as unclaimed
funds after this period. In view of this I got your
contact from a business contact enquiry. Note that you
do not need to have similar names with the late
beneficiary. I will give you 25% of the total. Upon
the receipt of your response, I will commence on
manipulating your information into the file as the
next of kin and I will send you information on how we
intend to actualize our objective in a legal manner.
I will not fail to bring to your notice that this
business is hitch free and that you should not
entertain any fear as all modalities for fund
transfer can be finalized within five banking days,
after your claim is established as the certified next
of kin to the deceased.
When you receive this letter. Kindly, send me your
private Tel/Fax Numbers thruogh my private emaill
address at dr_murphy_bello@ny.com for quick
communication
Awaiting your favorable response.
Yours truly,
Murphy Bello
messages.raw:
MURPHY BELLO

FROM THE DESK OF: MURPHY BELLO

MANAGER CREDIT AND FOREIGN BILLS.
UNION BANK PLC. dr_murphy_bello@ny.com
Attn: Sir
My name is Bello Ali the manager, credit and foreign bills of Union Bank Nigeria Plc. I am writing in respect of a foreign customer of my bank with account number 14-255-2004/utb/t who perished in a plane crash Korean Air Flight 801] with the whhome to claim his funds of USD$.30 m, [Thirty million United States dollars] which has been with my branch for a very long time. On this note, I decided to seek for a foreigner who I can present as the next of kin hence no one has come up to be the next of kin.
And the banking ethics here does not allow such money to stay more Than Eight years, after which the money will be called into the bank treasury as unclaimed funds after this period. In view of this I got your contact from a business contact enquiry. Note that you do not need to have similar names with the late beneficiary. I will give you 25% of the total. Upon the receipt of your response, I will commence on manipulating your information into the file as the next of kin and I will send you information on how we intend to actualize our objective in a legal manner.
I will not fail to bring to your notice that this business is hitch free and that you should not entertain any fear as all modalities for fund transfer can be finalized within five banking days, after your claim is established as the certified next of kin to the deceased.
When you receive this letter. Kindly, send me your private Tel/Fax Numbers thruogh my private emaill address at dr_murphy_bello@ny.com for quick communication
Awaiting your favorable response.
Yours truly,
Murphy Bello

[Dear readers, this is of course your basic Dead Bank Customer letter.]

messages.body:
Dear Mr Bello

I am very interested as to how you came by this address, and feel perhaps this message was intended for someone else? We live in Scotland and are expecting some important guests soon, which is why this note is necessarily rather abrupt.You should know of your misdirected mail at once as my wife and I think would be a real tragedy if you found no one to help you.

Thaneof

Thaneof Cawdor
3 Wiches Cauldron
King Duncan Street
Nr. Birnham Wood
Miracskyshire
ENGLAND
UR1 GIT

messages.body:
Dear Thaneof Cawdor,

 Thanks for your urgent response to my mail and all
 your explanations and interest to assist me conclude this transaction. I would like you to have it in mind
 that I have perfected all arrangements for the urgent
 approval and smooth transfer of the fund into any bank
 account that you might provide. Also you should not be
 afraid of any governmental authority (ies) regarding
 this money transfer because all documents that are
 going to cover you up in this transaction must be
 secured to back up the claim.
 I would like to know if your bank account is capable
 enough to receive the amount of money involved in this
 transaction without raising any eyebrow.
 Before we proceed, could you please tell me little
 about yourself? Your job, your age, marital status and
 what you feel we can invest this money into after
 successful conclusion of this transaction.
 Additionally, note that I am 52, have 4 kids (3 boys
 and 1 girl), my wife is late since 2 years now.
 Send to me immediately the following information: 1.
 Your complete names and address as they should appear
 in all documents. 2. Your bank account
 number and the bank details.
 Upon the receipt of the above-required information, we
 are going to contract the services of an attorney here
 who is going to secure all necessary documents and
 also represent you here. I soon as I hear from you I will send you the contact details of the lawyer.
 I am waiting for your immediate response and phone
 call on my direct phone number: 234-803-3271583.

 Regards,
 MURPHY BELLO ALI
 TEL: 234-8033271583
messages.raw:
MURPHY BELLO

Date: 24 May 2004 10:32:20 -0000

Thanks for your urgent response to my mail and all your explanations and interest to assist me conclude this transaction. I would like you to have it in mind

Also you should not be afraid of any governmental authority (ies) regarding this money transfer because all documents that are going to cover you up in this transaction must be secured to back up the claim.
I would like to know if your bank account is capable enough to receive the amount of money involved in this transaction without raising any eyebrow.
Before we proceed, could you please tell me little about yourself? Your job, your age, marital status and what you feel we can invest this money into after successful conclusion of this transaction.
Additionally, note that I am 52, have 4 kids (3 boys and 1 girl), my wife is late since 2 years now. Send to me immediately the following information: 1. Your complete names and address as they should appear in all documents. 2. Your bank account number and the bank details.
Upon the receipt of the above-required information, we are going to contract the services of an attorney here who is going to secure all necessary documents and also represent you here. I soon as I hear from you I will send you the contact details of the lawyer.
I am waiting for your immediate response and phone call on my direct phone number: 234-803-3271583.

Regards,
MURPHY BELLO ALI
TEL: 234-8033271583

messages.body:
My dear Dr Bello

I am glad that you got my message and am still not sure that it was originally intended for me. My wife and I are landowners with some expectations in Scotland, and this all seems very odd and out of our way.

I am 45 and my wife Quims is 43. We unfortunately do not have any children something which I envy you for, only my wife's dog, Spot. (Sorry for the brevity of this message but he has been rather a nuisance while I am typing this message incidentally and she has been telling the damn animal to get out). My bank is an Italian branch based here in Miracskyshire. I must admit I am hesitating about telling you more until I feel reassured in this matter.

Best regards

Thaneof Cawdor
3 Wiches Cauldron
King Duncan Street
Nr. Birnham Wood
Miracskyshire
ENGLAND
UR1 GIT

messages.subject: Very sorry.
messages.body:
Dear Thaneof Cawdor,

I am very sorry to inform you that I have changed my
email account to this meali@elvis.com to avoid some
unwanted persons to know what exactly we are doing.

Please, I would want you to send to me my first mail to
you regarding this transaction to reassure me that you
are the real Thaneof Cawdor. I will then explain more
to you on the way forward in this transaction.

I am waiting for your quick reply.

Please, you should not call me again at the number I
gave to you as it has been given to another staff here.

I will furnish you with my new phone number as soon as
I here from you.

Thank you for your co-operation.

Regards,
MURPHY BELLO ALI
messages.raw:
MURPHY BELLO

Please, I would want you to send to me my first mail to you regarding this transaction to reassure me that you are the real Thaneof Cawdor. I will then explain more to you on the way forward in this transaction.

I am waiting for your quick reply.

Please, you should not call me again at the number I gave to you as it has been given to another staff here.

I will furnish you with my new phone number as soon as I here from you.

Thank you for your co-operation.

Regards,
MURPHY BELLO ALI

Am I the real-false or the real-real Thane Of Cawdor?

Bello Ali.

messages.body:
Dear Dr Bello

I am surprised that you have not kept a copy of your own business correspondence, as I am very careful to retain everything, especially something of this importance. Fortunately I keep copies of everything: double double, less toil and trouble, which is always said here. Anyhow, I have pasted it at the end of this message.

My wife has asked me not to give out our phone number just at the moment as we are both still a bit wary, and so please be patient while we try and come to terms with the enormity of this business. What else can you do to reassure us that this matter will be legal and honest?

I wait to hear from you.

Regards

Thaneof Cawdor

THE THANE OF CAWDOR

messages.body:
Dear Mr Bello

I attached the copy you requested at the bottom of my last mailing, did you not see it?

Thank you for the reassurance and I think I am happy to proceed. My wife is less keen but I am hoping to talk her round and I need her consent before I can go ahead. Unfortunately Quims has a weakness for the drink and it is hard to predict her moods. I was seated in the bar area tonight, contemplating the pace of developments, a print out of your original message before me, when she walked in and noticed I had a glass half full of my favourite cocktail. Before I knew it she said 'Is this a dacquiri that I see before me?' and then drank it! I would not normally share this information with strangers, but I want you to know I am entirely honest with you and the difficulties I am facing.

What can you say to reassure her?

T
messages.raw:
THE THANE OF CAWDOR
Date: 26 May 2004, 12:31:32 PM

Dear Mr Bello

I attached the copy you requested at the bottom of my last mailing, did you not see it?

Thank you for the reassurance and I think I am happy to proceed. My wife is less keen but I am hoping to talk her round and I need her consent before I can go ahead. Unfortunately Quims has a weakness for the drink and it is hard to predict her moods. I was seated in the bar area tonight, contemplating the pace of developments, a print out of your original message before me, when she walked in and noticed I had a glass half full of my favourite cocktail. Before I knew it she said 'Is this a dacquiri that I see before me?' and then drank it! I would not normally share this information with strangers, but I want you to know I am entirely honest with you and the difficulties I am facing.

What can you say to reassure her?

T

messages.body:
My dear Mr Bello

My wife and I are now back from our short break at McSmegaroon and are concerned that we have heard no more from you. It may well be that you have found another helping hand and if so we hope that you get what you deserve in this business.

In the meantime, we have decided to pass along our phone number and fax number so that you can call us to show our sincerity in this matter.

Tel : 44 (0) 1350 727462
Fax : 44 (0) 1350 728979

Be sure to ask for my by name and I will come to the phone at once. After all, if it were done, (when it is done), then its well it is were done quickly.

I have taken the liberty of enquiring at the Banquo Scotland re the exchange of funds situation and they seem to think it should prove little problem.

Best wishes

Thaneof Cawdor
s

messages.subject: Thank you for tel/fax numbers.
messages.body:
Dear Sir,

I have been waiting for your information which I
requested from you and not that I found another person.
I am still ready to do this business with you as you
have shown me that you can handle same for me.

Please could send to me your mailing address so as to
enable my lawyer draft an agreement for us and to
quickly start processing the necessary documents in
your name as the next of kin and funds beneficiary.

I am waiting for this information and the lawyer will
surely contact you today and I will also call you as
planned before you sent the numbers. Thank you for the
numbers and please expect my call today and hope you
send the mailing address so that I can also forward
same to the lawyer.

Thank you for your co-operation in this matter.

Bello Ali M.
messages.raw:
MURPHY BELLO

Subject: Thank you for tel/fax numbers.
Date: Fri, 04 Jun 2004 02:27:03 -0700 (PDT)

Dear Sir,

I have been waiting for your information which I requested from you and not that I found another person. I am still ready to do this business with you as you have shown me that you can handle same for me.

Please could send to me your mailing address so as to enable my lawyer draft an agreement for us and to quickly start processing the necessary documents in your name as the next of kin and funds beneficiary.

I am waiting for this information and the lawyer will surely contact you today and I will also call you as planned before you sent the numbers. Thank you for the numbers and please expect my call today and hope you send the mailing address so that I can also forward same to the lawyer.

Thank you for your co-operation in this matter.

Bello Ali M.

messages.body:
My dear Mr Bello

We are all very excited about matters now here at the ranch. You may send all your documention to the address given at the end of this message. We hope your lawyer calls us promptly as we are going out soon. My wife unfortunately is not feeling very well and we are consulting a specialist. To be frank she has something of a compulsive cleaning disorder, constantly wringing her hands and so forth, and it has been a real worry but I am determined not to let this prove a distraction.

However rest assured that we do want to hear from your or your representative. If we are not here therefore please ask him to speak to my son Tossof.

Best wishes

Thaneof

THE THANE OF CAWDOR
Date: 04 Jun 2004, 03:03:27 AM

messages.body:
Dear Sir,

The number you gave me to call you was not right as
someone said that there is no such name there. What is
going on here. I was also told that the place is just a
hotel or a ranch. Please kindly confirm your number so
that we can talk.

Bello Ali M.
messages.raw:
MURPHY BELLO

Date: Fri, 04 Jun 2004 06:16:21 -0700 (PDT)

Dear Sir,

The number you gave me to call you was not right as someone said that there is no such name there. What is going on here. I was also told that the place is just a hotel or a ranch. Please kindly confirm your number so that we can talk.

Bello Ali M.

messages.body:
Mr Bello

Yes this correct; I am staying in this hotel for a few days for the grouse shooting season, sorry for the confusion I should have briefed the staff and given you all the details. Please redial and ask clearly and distinctly for Thaneof Cawdor, as sometimes the staff do not understand thick native accents. We are in room 419, registered in the of Isa Dyldo.

Failing this, give me your number and either myself or (if I am out on the moor) Tossof will call you back at once. I am worried now that you are not entirely serious in this matter- after all this is not child's play my friend! In fact, last night I hardly had any rest and had to use a local bed quilt called a MacDuff to keep myself comfortable. It was not until I thought to lay on MacDuff that I had an easy night of it. This is turning into a right old drama.

Please call as soon as you can.
messages.raw:
THE THANE OF CAWDOR
Date: 04 Jun 2004, 07:14:32 AM

Failing this, give me your number and either myself or (if I am out on the moor) Tossof will call you back at once. I am worried now that you are not entirely serious in this matter- after all this is not child's play my friend! In fact, last night I hardly had any rest and had to use a local bed quilt called a MacDuff to keep myself comfortable. It was not until I thought to lay on MacDuff that I had an easy night of it. This is turning into a right old drama.

Please call as soon as you can.
